attributes.action: Ensure that Baby P gets justice and order a retrial of the Baby P Three
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Baby P three have been convicted of “causing or allowing the death of a child” carrying a maximum jail sentence of 14 years. 

How can they be found innocent of manslaughter or murder when Victoria Climbie's carers were convicted of murder and sentenced to life imprisonment?  Both Baby P and Victoria are dead as a result of deliberate systematic physical abuse, so how can there be such a huge discrepancy in convictions?

Those who deliberately inflicted Baby P's injuries, had done it before and in all likelihood knew that they would do it again and again, especially given that the boyfriend has been described as 'fascinated with pain'.  Isn't that premeditation?  Those who deliberately covered up his injuries, and in doing so deliberately deprived him of the medical care he so urgently needed knew what they were doing. Their cover-ups were also premeditated.  No one can possibly claim that they don't know that continual and extreme violence against a child might kill them.

Please ensure that Baby P gets justice by signing this petition to demand a retrial.  Thank you.

rejection.details: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
